workspace.name: 1f-semantics-mlw17
workspace.query:
#Show me the name of the customers which purchased the product "Domainer" PREFIX : <http://www.marklogic.com/orders#>
SELECT ?lname WHERE { ?customer :label $lname . ?customer :placed ?order . ?order :contains ?product . $product :label "Domainer". }

" This workspace illustrates Semantics by demonstrating how we can create and query triples using thesem:* API.
We envelope our Order entities and add a triples header to the envelope which contains the relationships:
CustomerID placed OrderID. OrderID contains ProductID.
We additionally add comments to our relationships and labels for our Customers and Products.
"

xquery version "1.0-ml"; (: Use this tab as required to reinsert customer, order, and product : documents into the DB prior to starting this workspace :)

let $cust-a-docs := $cust-a-records/customer let $count := fn:count($cust-a-docs) let $cust-a-reset := for $d at $idx in $cust-a-docs let $uri := fn:concat("/denormalized/customer-",$idx,".xml") return xdmp:document-insert($uri, <customer>{$d/node()}</customer>, (), ("customer", "system-a", "enveloped", "harmonized"))

let $prod-docs := $product-doc/record let $count := fn:count($prod-docs) let $prod-doc-reset := for $d at $idx in $prod-docs let $uri := fn:concat("/product-",$idx,".xml") return xdmp:document-insert($uri, <product>{$d/node()}</product>, (), "product")

let $order-docs := $order-doc/order let $count := fn:count($order-docs) let $order-doc-reset := for $d at $idx in $order-docs let $uri := fn:concat("/order-",$idx,".xml") return xdmp:document-insert($uri, <order>{$d/node()}</order>, (), ("order", "enveloped","harmonized"))
return ($cust-a-reset, $cust-b-reset, $prod-doc-reset), "You've just loaded the following into the Documents DB: - the enveloped and harmonized system-a and system-b customer records - enveloped order documents containing triples - updated product documents "
